intro: Erophila propinqua, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, opposite leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Erophila propinqua is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
